title: Sine-Gordon model at finite temperature: the method of random surfaces
authors: M. T\'oth, J. H. Pixley, D. Sz\'asz-Schagrin, G. Tak\'acs, M. Kormos
abstract:
We study the sine-Gordon quantum field theory at finite temperature by
generalizing the method of random surfaces to compute the free energy and
one-point functions of exponential operators non-perturbatively. Focusing on
the gapped phase of the sine-Gordon model, we demonstrate the method's accuracy
by comparing our results to the predictions of other methods and to exact
results in the thermodynamic limit. We find excellent agreement between the
method of random surfaces and other approaches when the temperature is not too
small with respect to the mass gap. Extending the method to more general
problems in strongly interacting one-dimensional quantum systems is discussed.
